A Python library for parsing and creating TOML configuration files. For
more information on the TOML standard, see https://github.com/toml-
lang/toml.git

dependencies.description:
Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible
with TOML v1.0.0.
dependencies.name: py-tomli

dependent_to.description:
This package provides a unified command line interface to Amazon Web
Services.

anndata is a Python package for handling annotated data matrices in

CacheControl is a port of the caching algorithms in httplib2 for use

Circus is a program that will let you run and watch multiple processes
and sockets.
dependent_to.name: py-circus

dependent_to.description: Extended pickling support for Python objects.

dependent_to.description:
Simple library for color and formatting to terminal Very simple Python
library for color and formatting in terminal. Collection of color codes
and names for 256 color terminal setups. The following is a list of 256
colors for Xterm, containing an example of the displayed color, Xterm
Name, Xterm Number and HEX.
dependent_to.name: py-colored

dependent_to.description: Tools for color research
dependent_to.name: py-colorio

dependent_to.description: Additional utilities for click.
dependent_to.name: py-consolekit

dependent_to.description:

markup documents (HTML, XML, etc.) that can be read by ElementTree-like
parsers (including cElementTree, lxml, html5lib, etc.)
dependent_to.name: py-cssselect2

A PEP 518 build backend that uses setuptools_scm to generate a version

dependent_to.description: Low-level, pure Python DBus protocol wrapper.

dependent_to.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependent_to.description:
Orbax includes a checkpointing library oriented towards JAX users,
supporting a variety of different features required by different
frameworks, including asynchronous checkpointing various types, and
various storage formats. We aim to provide a highly customizable and
composable API which maximizes flexibility for diverse use cases.
dependent_to.name: py-orbax-checkpoint

dependent_to.description:
An OrderedSet is a mutable data structure that is a hybrid of a list and
a set. It remembers the order of its entries, and every entry has an
index number that can be looked up.
dependent_to.name: py-ordered-set

dependent_to.description: Core utilities for Python packages.
dependent_to.name: py-packaging

dependent_to.description:
pathspec extends the test loading and running features of unittest,
making it easier to write, find and run tests.
dependent_to.name: py-pathspec

dependent_to.name: py-pkgutil-resolve-name

dependent_to.description: Run a subprocess in a pseudo terminal
dependent_to.name: py-ptyprocess

dependent_to.description:
Pure python package for DICOM medical file reading and writing pydicom
is a pure Python package for working with DICOM files. It lets you read,
modify and write DICOM data in an easy "pythonic" way.
dependent_to.name: py-pydicom

dependent_to.description: Easier Pythonic interface to GMSH.

dependent_to.description: A Python Parsing Module.

dependent_to.description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.
dependent_to.name: py-scanpy

dependent_to.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.
dependent_to.name: py-seaborn

sphinxcontrib-devhelp is a sphinx extension which outputs Devhelp

Python helpers to limit the number of threads used in the threadpool-
backed of common native libraries used for scientific computing and data
science (e.g. BLAS and OpenMP).

dependent_to.description:
tinycss2 is a low-level CSS parser and generator written in Python: it
can parse strings, return objects representing tokens and blocks, and
generate CSS strings corresponding to these objects.
dependent_to.name: py-tinycss2

Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible

well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

quantification, calibration, metrics, and visualization.
